    Single history workflow

    single_history.Rmd

    Setting up

    Below is an example of a more complicated workflow, starting from a simple input file, to be used as an example of a full rtrackr workflow.

    We will define and log a simple dataframe for this example. For more information, please see Getting started.

    df <- data.frame(a = c('a', 'b', 'c'), b = c(1, 2, 3))
    Details
    a b
    a 1
    b 2
    c 3 
    trackr_dir <- '~/Documents/Personal/trackr_dev/trackr_dir'

#setup a new trackr
df <- trackr_new(df, trackr_dir = trackr_dir, timepoint_message = 'Start', log_data = T)
    ## [1] "Successfully written trackr file 82199135ba2baab84e36019392eba0989ccf4c11.json"
## [1] "Successfully written trackr data log 82199135ba2baab84e36019392eba0989ccf4c11_dl.json"

    Workflow

    #make some change to the data 
df <- df %>% dplyr::mutate(b = b + 1)

df <- trackr_timepoint(df, trackr_dir = trackr_dir, timepoint_message = 'Change point #1', log_data = T)
    ## [1] "Successfully written trackr file d050aa31672cd2d8637ac3a874b30c4f2f9e80b8.json"
## [1] "Successfully written trackr data log d050aa31672cd2d8637ac3a874b30c4f2f9e80b8_dl.json"
    Details
    a b trackr_id
    a 2 d050aa31672cd2d8637ac3a874b30c4f2f9e80b8_9b298ab2c9539c0d7f187ce26315f459fa58e78e
    b 3 d050aa31672cd2d8637ac3a874b30c4f2f9e80b8_0d62e87ad3877b0c51934dd0c38cba3467375b09
    c 4 d050aa31672cd2d8637ac3a874b30c4f2f9e80b8_b1ba9407cf19da9a3625e46f5378484323799a05 
    #repeat for subsequent processing steps
df <- df %>% dplyr::mutate(b = b + 300)

df <- trackr_timepoint(df, trackr_dir = trackr_dir, timepoint_message = 'Change point #2', log_data = T)
    ## [1] "Successfully written trackr file efc98c4263258bc32391fe580e5c253a522e5910.json"
## [1] "Successfully written trackr data log efc98c4263258bc32391fe580e5c253a522e5910_dl.json"
    Details
    a b trackr_id
    a 302 efc98c4263258bc32391fe580e5c253a522e5910_df6c36b931b3c85b98b33b3be98d70c6c3569d95
    b 303 efc98c4263258bc32391fe580e5c253a522e5910_ad3a917f44d6a3f9fbc121c14cf631784c721fc4
    c 304 efc98c4263258bc32391fe580e5c253a522e5910_20e8c8352858485ba2abdc2a151f5cc2dbcf4503 
    #splitting a single record into multiples
df <- rbind(df, df %>% dplyr::mutate(b = b -300))

df <- trackr_timepoint(df, trackr_dir = trackr_dir, timepoint_message = 'Dividing rows', log_data = T)
    ## [1] "Successfully written trackr file dd7ec459393bfdada7bf8e495c8999126922086d.json"
## [1] "Successfully written trackr data log dd7ec459393bfdada7bf8e495c8999126922086d_dl.json"
    Details
    a b trackr_id
    a 302 dd7ec459393bfdada7bf8e495c8999126922086d_df6c36b931b3c85b98b33b3be98d70c6c3569d95
    b 303 dd7ec459393bfdada7bf8e495c8999126922086d_ad3a917f44d6a3f9fbc121c14cf631784c721fc4
    c 304 dd7ec459393bfdada7bf8e495c8999126922086d_20e8c8352858485ba2abdc2a151f5cc2dbcf4503
    a 2 dd7ec459393bfdada7bf8e495c8999126922086d_9b298ab2c9539c0d7f187ce26315f459fa58e78e
    b 3 dd7ec459393bfdada7bf8e495c8999126922086d_0d62e87ad3877b0c51934dd0c38cba3467375b09
    c 4 dd7ec459393bfdada7bf8e495c8999126922086d_b1ba9407cf19da9a3625e46f5378484323799a05 
    #summarising data
df <- df %>% dplyr::group_by(a)

df <- trackr_summarise(df, n = dplyr::n())
    ## Joining, by = "a"
    df <- trackr_timepoint(df, trackr_dir = trackr_dir, timepoint_message = 'Summarising rows', log_data = T)
    ## [1] "Successfully written trackr file cff69ce9cc8ab565e77de02181117e88063e269f.json"
## [1] "Successfully written trackr data log cff69ce9cc8ab565e77de02181117e88063e269f_dl.json"
    Details
    a n trackr_id
    a 2 cff69ce9cc8ab565e77de02181117e88063e269f_9b298ab2c9539c0d7f187ce26315f459fa58e78e
    b 2 cff69ce9cc8ab565e77de02181117e88063e269f_d6543aeb67806714fa9e9567dc5c46b2106ae843
    c 2 cff69ce9cc8ab565e77de02181117e88063e269f_c7a74dd8ad5c5743a5983d3102600cc7f9df9370 
    df <- df %>% dplyr::mutate(n = n**runif(3))

df <- trackr_timepoint(df, trackr_dir = trackr_dir, timepoint_message = 'Further Processing', log_data = T)
    ## [1] "Successfully written trackr file 37128af6796023af166802b4156ac116653e6ff7.json"
## [1] "Successfully written trackr data log 37128af6796023af166802b4156ac116653e6ff7_dl.json"
    Details
    a n trackr_id
    a 1.167046 37128af6796023af166802b4156ac116653e6ff7_bb24c168790cca844e6ba3246deeff363cfe0c2d
    b 1.612720 37128af6796023af166802b4156ac116653e6ff7_3a0c04995909902d4817dcf5ca42f56d928d88b5
    c 1.887458 37128af6796023af166802b4156ac116653e6ff7_5a060a767434aec70552a70c0bbef8cc35461d5a 
    df <- rbind(df, df %>% dplyr::mutate(n = n -60), df %>% dplyr::mutate(n = n * 2), df %>% dplyr::mutate(n = n * 56))

df <- trackr_timepoint(df, trackr_dir = trackr_dir, timepoint_message = 'Really messing with things', log_data = T)
    ## [1] "Successfully written trackr file 289a86b8156217db82e4ceb66a0175db108224e1.json"
## [1] "Successfully written trackr data log 289a86b8156217db82e4ceb66a0175db108224e1_dl.json"

    b 90.312323 289a86b8156217db82e4ceb66a0175db108224e1_6f6c9f94fb89fc34e1fd6e7f573cc49b708141b5
    c 105.697641 289a86b8156217db82e4ceb66a0175db108224e1_07ed0378ae83f85e2a563c1b333c54327222e3d7 
    df <- df %>% dplyr::mutate(n = n + 1)

df <- trackr_timepoint(df, trackr_dir = trackr_dir, timepoint_message = 'added 1', log_data = T)
    ## [1] "Successfully written trackr file f5e6e4c30fe25c83dd264032ea4f72f1672466ad.json"

    df <- df %>% dplyr::group_by(a) %>%
  trackr_summarise(n =  dplyr::n())
    ## Joining, by = "a"
    df <- trackr_timepoint(df, trackr_dir = trackr_dir, timepoint_message = 'grouped', log_data = T)
    ## [1] "Successfully written trackr file e21b9149b58d456b3283bcd71a678e4a0e6b732e.json"

    Results

    Inspect the full processing chain of a single record with trackr_lineage() and trackr_network().

    target_id <- df$trackr_id[1]
trackr_lineage(target_id, trackr_dir)
    ## [1] "Successfully written 4273c0225c07529a2688a1954950d09fbbb14c25_2a8b275852b4085d374094c98a3f95bc0e22ec3b_lineage.json"
    lineage_fn <- paste0(trackr_dir, '/', target_id, '_lineage.json')

trackr_network(lineage_fn)

    Clean up

    clean_trackr_dir(trackr_dir)
